selected_quotes: #NDIS roll-out: co-ordinated national strategy to encourage independent living for participants still needed
The NDIS still has a housing gap – but smarter designs could help close it
#NDIS supports independent living for people with #disability - #IDShousing is creating solutions - but where else?

citation.abstract: As the NDIS roll-out begins, Australia faces a housing shortfall affecting up to 122,000 participants. Developing smart technology and design offers more independent living for people with disability.
citation.title: Bringing the NDIS home: smarter housing design for people with disability

facebook.title: Bringing the NDIS home: smarter housing design for people with disability
facebook.summary:
Bringing the NDIS home: smarter housing design for people with disability

Australia’s A$22 billion National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) remains a key policy of the Coalition government. One of Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull’s first major tasks was

facebook.title: Bringing the NDIS home: smarter housing design for people with disability
facebook.summary: As the NDIS roll-out begins, Australia faces a housing shortfall affecting up to 122,000 participants. Developing smart technology and design offers more independent living for people with disability.

facebook.title: Bringing the NDIS home: smarter housing design for people with disability
facebook.summary: The NDIS will provide reasonable and necessary support for many people with disability, but appropriate and accessible housing is desperately needed. Libby Callaway's article in The Conversation outlines how smarter housing will make a difference.

facebook.title: Bringing the NDIS home: smarter housing design for people with disability
facebook.summary: RIPL Project One was a collaboration between the TAC and the Summer Foundation, a non-profit organisation focused on the issue of young people in nursing homes.

news.title: NDIS housing rules for people with a disability could be life-changing
news.summary: The National Disability Insurance Scheme (Specialist Disability Accommodation) Rules were tabled in federal parliament in mid-March.

source.name: Australian Policy Online
source.description: Australia Policy Online (APO) is a research database and alert service providing free access to full-text research reports and papers, statistics and other resources essential for public policy development and implementation in Australia and New Zealand.
